Completed: While "completed" is a valid word, it doesn't fit well in this sentence because it suggests a successful finish rather than the act of attempting something. It implies that the attempt was successful, which may not be the case. Exercised: This word doesn't convey the right meaning in the context of attempting to complete work successfully. "Exercised" is more commonly used in the context of using one's rights, authority, or power. So, "made" is the most suitable choice as it accurately reflects the initiation of an attempt without implying its success or failure.
